11311.content:
We're running through the airport, out of breath and with our bags pulling behind us. "I think it's to the left!" I shout and point at the electronic sign giving our flight details.
Me (Alex) and my friend Jim (the idiot who forgot to set his alarm) are going to Aspen for a week to hang out with some friends during the holidays.

As we eventually manage to find the right gate, a not-so impressed woman is standing behind the counter glaring at us while we're and trying to find our passports and tickets. "You know we prefer if you arrive an hour early, not five minutes late" the lady says, looking at me. "Blame this guy" I said, pointing at Jim between breaths as I hand over my papers. "Sorry miss" Jim says panting, and does the same.

The others are already in their seats. John is sitting next to Ellie (who's already snoring loud enough to annoy a married couple in the seats behind her) and Melody is sitting by the opposite end of the plane next to a window, seemingly reading a book.

I take my seat next to Melody and Jim finds his seat next to a middle-aged man a couple of rows in front of us. Melody closes her books and greets my by asking why we were so late. "Jim forgot to set his alarm" I said, pointing at Jim, who's trying to fit his baggage in without disrupting his seatbuddy's slumber. She shoots me a look of distaste. She was the type of person who always played by the rules and probably camped outside the airport tonight just to make sure she got here on time.
"Hey, it's not my fault!" I said. "At least you made it on time" she said, now cracking a smile.
11311.title: Aspen

113112.content:
We arrive around three and a half hours later. There's a surge of people getting up and leaving the plane at once, so Melody and I wait till things have emptied out a bit. Upon exiting the plane, I'm immediately struck by the cold Aspen air. Sure, Toronto doesn't have the warmest winters in the world, but most of my clothes are neatly packed in my bag.

We move towards the baggage claim to meet up with the others. John and Ellie seem to be as prepared for the weather as I am, based on their chivering gestures.

"So now what?" Melody says. John takes a quick look at his watch after grabbing his bags. "The taxi's will be here any moment, so I'm guessing we make our way out of the airport and see if we can find them." This was concluded with a "Fair enough" by Jim. I pick up my bag and my backpack and follow the others as we're trying to find the exit.

There's no way we could all squeeze into one cab, so we split up into two groups. Me, Jim and Ellie in the first one, John and Melody in the other. The cars were already there, so we (with the help of the driver) put our stuff in the trunk and took our seats.
113112.title: Arriving in Aspen

1131121.content:
I liked Aspen. In many aspects it gave me the impression of a stereotypical winter wonderland. It was only a ten minute cab ride to the hotel. The cab driver tried to socialize a bit with Ellie, who had already dozed off again, so he turned his attention to me and Jim instead. "So what brings you here?" he asked. "We just wanted a break from school. Hang out with friends and stuff"
"Sounds nice! How long will you be staying?"
"The rest of the week" I said.
"Try heading out to the pub by the lake. A lot of tourists seem to like it. Great food, nice place to meet new people." he said.

I wasn't much of a party person. Jim was though. The rest of the group too, for that matter. "No matter. Fun stuff to do there even if you aren't. I take the wife there sometimes and she's pretty reserved"

"We'll check it out" Jim said with a grin, right as the cab slowed down in front of the hotel.


The others arrived right after. Jim, Ellie (who had woken up as the car stopped) decided not to wait and just walk in.
1131121.title: The hotel

11311211.content:
The hotel looked more like an enormous Bed and Breakfast than a hotel. It was basically a giant wooden mansion that looked a lot more modern inside than what it would appear fom the outside. Shiny dark tiled floors, wooden walls and a sitting area right by the entrance. We walked up to the receptionist.

"Welcome to Pine Peak Hotel. How may I help you?" said the receptionist cheerfully. A woman, rather cute. Probably only a year or two older than myself.
"Yeah hi, we had some reservations?" said Ellie.
"Sure! What's your names?"

"Ellie McNeill" said Ellie, who was in front of the line. "Let's see... Ah, here. You'll get room 102" said the woman and handed her a key. Jim walked up next. "Jim Davis" he said, and received his key to room 104. Both Jim and Ellie stepped aside as I walked up to the counter. "And you sir?" asked the cute receptionist. "Alex Thomson" I said.

She looked at the computer a bit puzzled. She was scrolling up whatever page she was looking on. "I'm sorry Mr. Thomson, but I can't find your reservation."
I was confused. "Are you sure? I did the reservation at the same time as everyone else here!"
"I'm sorry, I can't find anything!"
"Then can I book another room right now?" I asked.
"Sadly we're all booked for the week, there's no other rooms available."
"Well what do I do now then?" I said. I was getting a bit worked up. I'm in a different country and don't even have a place to stay.
"No worries, you can just stay in one of our rooms" said Jim, then turned to the receptionist. "Is it possible to fix another bed for one of the rooms?"
"Absolutely" she said. "Would you be okay with that arrangement?" she said and turned back to me.

"Yeah, it works for me as long as it works for them" I said.
"You can bunk with me" said Ellie.
"Alright then!" I answered. "Thanks El"
"No worries. Just don't stay up late to party in my room or something" she smiled.
"Like that'd wake YOU up." said Jim, after which she punched him on the arm.


"Okay then Mr. Thomson, I'll have another bed sent up as soon as possible"

We arrived to the pub around eight minutes or so later. Seemed kind of stereotypical for a traditional pub. It was more or less a wide log cabin. Dark to the color, but still sort of cozy to the look. "Dwayne's" said the big sign outside. We stepped in and it looked more or less like a regular restaurant. There was a bar there, but I'm guessing it stays closed until later in the evening when all the families are done dining. Aside from that there were also some old pinball machines, a TV for the common sports fan and a bunch of (mostly) occupied tables.

1131121111122111222122.content:
I was suddenly jolted back awake by the sound of a slamming door. Was it Ellie?
I threw myself into a sitting position only to find Jim standing at the entrance, staring back at me. Oh no. Nononono.
"Uh" he started. This was it. I was doomed.
"Does Ellie know you're using her clothes?" he said.

Wait what? THAT was his opening line? Not "Who are you?" or "Nice boobs Alex"? Confused, I looked down at myself. I was still wearing all of Ellie's clothing, the leggings, the t-shirt, the make up (and yes, the underwear too) only somehow, I was no longer a girl.

I was unable to speak. I ran my hands over my upper body and and felt a surge of happiness. I was back to being myself. At first I was delighted, then I realized that this brought on a whole new kind of awkward. Jim was looking at me, taking a nap in El's clothes. "No no, I was just-" I tried.
"No, hey, do what you want in your own spare time man" Jim said as he walked further into the hotel room. I almost exclaimed "I can explain", but realized that I really can't. "Uh. Can you do me a favor and not tell anyone about this?" I said.
"Trust me, I don't want to remember seeing this either" he said.

Before I could collect my thoughts or even coprehend how I was now back to myself, I walked over to my bags and switched back to my regular outfit, pretending he really had just caught me crossdressing or something. It felt awesome to put on familiar clothing again. "Sooo" I started. "How was breakfast?"

Jim looked awkward. "Yeahh.. I was just popping in to ask if you wanted to head into town with us. Thought you were still nauseous but it turns out you were just-"
"Dude, this wasn't what it looked like."
"Suure it wasn't" he said and gave a wink. "I like your make up by the way" he said and pointed at my face.

At the realization I ran into the bathroom and washed the products off my face. I stared back at the mirror and felt calmer as I saw the familiarity of my own reflection staring back at me. I could also sense the presence of something else I had been missing this morning, something more down to the south.

"So are you coming?" Alex called out.
"Yeah, just grabbing my wallet and keys" I said. "Sure. I'll wait outside."
"And what you saw never happened, agreed?"
"Agreed. Though next time, at least ask for her permission first." he said.
"It's NOT what it looked like" I repeated, but he wasn't listening. He had already left the room.
1131121111122111222122.title: Jim

11331.content:
My name is Issac, at least it is while I am a boy. As a girl, I call myself Cassi. Confused? So was I when it first happened. My mom, dad, big sister, and I were visiting Hong Kong during the Chinese new year on our last vacation. We were trying the local restaurants, exploring the streets and the curiosity stores. It was in one such shop where my life forever turned upside down. I found an old wooden mask that looked very much like the face of a porcelain doll. To me, it was the most beautiful thing I had ever seen. The shop keeper, an elderly woman who introduced herself as Lin noticed my interest and showed concern.

"Be very careful with that, young man." Serious, she warned. "It is quite old and carries a dark tale which have ruined many lives."

"It's cursed?" Curious, I asked.

"You could look at it that way." Softly, Lin replied. "Legends say that a woman scorned by her cheating husband made the mask with dark magic to transform her husband into a beautiful woman only it instead gave her a teenage daughter." She smiled seeing me wince. "The mask is said to still have some magic left in it so I say to you, buy it at your own risk."

"That is a creepy story." Unnerved, I said.

Karen, my older sister giggled. "I don't know, I think you'd look cute as a girl." Joking, she said.

Mom smiled at that and payed for the mask. "I think it's adorable." Taking it from me, she said. She held it in front of my face, smiling. "It looks to be just your size..."

"No! Don't!" Startled, Lin called.

Too late. The mask flew from mom's hands and planted itself upon my face. My entire body immediately felt like it was on fire! I thrashed about, falling to the floor in convulsions. I could hear Karen and mom shouting my name in concern but I was in too much pain to respond. Within seconds, I passed out.

When I woke up hours later, I found myself lying on a couch in the back room of the curiosity shop with Lin looking over me. She sighed in relief upon seeing me wake up then turned to my mom with a stern look. "You people need to learn to take the warnings of an elderly woman more seriously!" Firmly, she scolded. "Now you have a boarder gender to raise."

"A boarder gender?" Confused, I asked.

"There was not enough magic left in the mask to permanently make you a girl but there was enough to give you the ability to be a girl or a boy at will." Turning to me, Lin said. "Before you smile at the perverted possibilities, remember that, as a girl you will have all of the same problems that all girls do and you will not be able to change back when 'that' time of the month comes your way."

I frowned at that, turning to mom and Karen who both winced. "How were we supposed to know the story was real?" Defending herself, Karen demanded. She sighed. "Maybe some of my clothes will fit you until we can go shopping.. Cassi."

Mom giggled slightly at Karen's pick for my female name but winced as I asked, "Why can't I change back into a boy now?"

Lin sighed. "Because this is that time of the month I mentioned." Serious, she said. "You are going to be female for at least three to five days and you will change without warning when that time comes again, every month."

"That will complicate things." Wincing, I said.

"I could have been worse." Darkly, Lin said. "There are worse curses than becoming a woman, even if it is part time..."


I sighed, thinking back to that vacation. I was a boy again, flying home with two sets of clothing in my luggage. One for when I am a boy and one for when I am a girl. In the short two weeks we had left since entering that curiosity shop, Karen and mom had given me a crash course in how to act like a lady and I had learned the trigger that switches my gender at will. It was...

The first two weeks were the hardest for me. The transformations were annoying, painful, and seemingly random. Some times I was changing two-three times a day. Others I went two-three days with no change at all. We tried to figure out what was causing them to trigger the curse. Was it a certain, smell, thought, time of day, or emotion? We spent the first two weeks trying to learn how the curse worked while giving me the quickest crash course in female training they could. However in two weeks we still learned very little.

Here is what we learned so far:

The transformations occur seeingly random but seemed to be limited to no more than three times a day. Also it seems three days is the maximum amount of time allowed before a change must occur.

The transformation are quick but very powerful and painful. The signal of a change is a powerful heat like feelings that spreads over my body. They usually take around 5-8 minutes depending if I was actually trying to resist the changes. They seem to always start with the hands and end with the face.

My clothes seem to change and adapt with me, which is the one positive about this curse. The outfit I change into seems to reflect the clothing I am wearing during a change. However I have begun to notice my female outfits are getting more and more girly.

As Cassie my memory is still my own. I am still me and I love all the same things. However I am starting to notice new strange feelings and desires and certain changes to my emotional state. I’m not sure if this is just do to stress of my situation or if it is the beginning of something else...

On a personal note I’ve noticed a few extra things as well.:

My parents seem to treat me better whenever I am Cassie. They pay more attention to me, let me get away with more, and offer to buy me more female stuff.

Karen my older sister however has shifted her attitude towards me greatly recently. After the first few changes she loved seeing me a girl. He laughed and joked a lot at my expense but now things are different. She is acting more competitive and jealous around me lately. I’m not sure but I think she is starting to think I am becoming prettier and sexier than she is.

Both my male and female bodies are still changing. I have noticed I’m not the same bra size as when I started and my hair seems to grow even when I am male.

Lastly my parents set up this video diary which I am to talk to every night before bed. They want me to document my life since I am one person living a life of two genders. Well that’s it for me. This is Isaac signing off we will see who I am in the morning.

You turned off your computer and climbed into bed wondering just what tomorrow would bring.

I sighed. "I'll stay. At least that way, you have an excuse not to stay at work all night."

Dad chuckled, roughing up my hair. "You got a point there, sport." Smiling, he said. "I'll see you in a few hours."

I tried not to blush as dad left then turned to find Manuel walking up to me with his sister, Mia. Both had longish light brown hair and emerald green eyes, they were fraternal twins. What worried me was that they both seemed very nervous as they looked at me. "Is everyone effected by this?" Wide eyes, Mia muttered.

I gulped. "What- what do you mean?" Trying to sound light, I asked.

Manuel sighed. "I'm really Mia." Surprising you, she replied. "This is really Manuel." She sighed. "We know that's really you... Hannah."

my eyes went wide. "I- I swapped places with a boy who looked just like me in the mirror this morning." Tearing up, I said. "I thought it was just me."

"Your dad and ours both work for a research company that does business with the government." Darkly, Mia explained. "From what we've been able to piece together, after breaking into our dad's private office, is that there was some sort of experiment being run that went terribly wrong."

I felt my heart jump into my throat. My crush was now in the body of his sister?! "What sort of experiment?"

"It involved a parallel world where everyone was of the opposite gender." Sadly, Mia said. "The experiment was a total disaster as it cause a lot of people to swap places with those on the other side."

"What is worse is that reality, at least on this side, has changed so everyone sees us as our new forms." Frowning, Mia said. "We can only hope that our dads are working to fix this." She shuddered. "Only, as your dad wanted a son..."

I turned pale. "He may not want to fix it, at least when it comes to me."

1251111123111111.content:
Upon returning home, you noticed that the door to dad's study was open ajar. You found it strange as dad had always kept the door to his study closed and locked. Still, this was not your world so you slowly entered to see what you could find. The den looked as if it had been ransacked with papers all over the floor, on the desk, and the pull out couch. There was a large dry erase board on the far end of the room which showed a number of mathematical formulas that were well beyond your level to understand. "Dad must have been going crazy looking for a solution to this mess his company made." softly, you muttered.

Among the scribbled notes on the dry erase board was the word 'breakthrough'. Curious, you read the note... We can communicate for short periods of time with the other world through the camera app but only to those we had swapped bodies with as we only know our own phone numbers...

Reading this made you more curious and you decided to call your own phone and leave a message, 'Open your camera app!' before opening your own.

Seconds later, you saw your female self on your own camera app! "Oh my goodness, it worked!" Relief in your voice, you said. "I'm glad to see you haven't changed anything..."

"Mom is listening..." Almost whispering, the girl warned. Then she said out loud, "What's up?"

Getting her message, you frowned. "It's a bit chaotic on my end, I'm afraid." Serious, you said. "The family is going through a lot of changes and dad is caught up at work in the middle of it all." Sighing, you added, "I can't promise when we will be able to meet up again."

"It's a bit rough over here too." Wincing, the girl replied. "Mom thinks I have boy issues."

You chuckled at that. "All mothers think their daughters have boy issues." Grinning, you said. You paused hearing the ding warning that your phone battery was starting to die. "Damn it!" Frustrated, you thought. "Why now of all times?!" Knowing you had little time, you added, "We're out of time. I'll try to call you back later, okay."

"Okay... Hanson." Softly, the girl said.

With that, your cellphone died, ending the call. Sighing, you turned to the dry erase board and moaned as you saw a second note that read: Communication between worlds requires much energy. a fully charged cell phone is required for lengthy talks.

"I better get this on the charger." Frustrated, you said. "At least we now have a way to talk to each other. Perhaps 'Hannah' knows something we don't."

Mom smiled sweetly at me. "I had the jitters too my first time." Gently, she said. "I promise you, though there is nothing to be scared of."

She then gently coaxed me out from under the blankets and urged me to get dressed. The panties were easy enough but I had a bit of a problem with the bra. Fortunately, mom seemed very patient and helped me get it on. I had half expected mom to put me into a tutu or at least a leotard with a skirt but instead, she handed me a pair of snug sweat pants and blouse. "I know you are a tomboy, Hanson." Patiently, she said. "Only I have a feeling this ballet school will surprise you."

I was grateful to be given sweats instead of a ballerina costume but mom's words confused me. "What do you mean?" Softly, I demanded.

Mom smiled. "This ballet school also trains football players in the fine art of ballet." Softly, she said.

I gasped at that. "They do not!" Disbelieving, I snapped.

"How do you think those big burly boys learned how to tip toe along the line of scrimmage with men trying to tackle them without falling over?" Bemused, she asked. "It's all ballet, my dear."

To say I was surprised would have been an understatement. "Am I going to learn along side boys?" Wincing, I asked.

"Only if you decide to sign up." Smiling, mom said. "Ten is the youngest they take girls at this school and you just turned ten yesterday."

I was relieved to hear that I wasn't going to this school for ballet lessons, at least not until mom decided to sign me up. Still, I knew it was only a matter of time given how much she loves the tradition and grace of the dance.

Diary entire
Yesterday when I finished work I went out with a girl I work with at the bar and get pretty drunk.

I woke up this morning with a banging hangover to realise I was in bed naked with a guy, he was asleep so I got dressed and come home.

Once I was home I realised I was aching all over as if I had been to the gym, "thank god I didn't remember anything" I got I the shower and cleaned myself.

The later on I got a flash back at first nothing really but eventually all the memories from last night came rushing back and it turned out I got very drunk and let a guy fuck me all over his apartment.

End of the entire

I am ashamed I let myself do that although I do feel slightly less on edge about most things now as if a pressure was released from me.

Few days later everything is back to normal although my period is later
